reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the Jockey Club, 2 bedroom/2 bath/kitchen and den unit, from March 18 through the 23rd, 2013. We had 5 people there (1 couple in each bedroom and 1 person on a roll out double bed couch.) It was a great experience. The Jockey Club is nestled between the Cosmopolitan and Bellagio. It actually connects to the Cosmopolitan via an elevator. You have full access to all the amenities the Cosmopolitan has to offer including their great pool. There's an easy access to the Bellagio too so you don't have to go down to the street to walk back up to the Bellagio. We had an incredible view of the fountains at the Bellagio and the whole Strip headed down past the Mirage, etc. There are two crosswalks across the Strip right in front of the Jockey Club which is really convenient. The rooms were clean, the flat screen TV's were great, the kitchen had everything you need (non food and drink) and the housekeeping staff was attentive. The only caveat is DON'T DO THE TIME SHARE PRESENTATION IN ORDER TO GET THE FREE INCENTIVES. If you don't do that, The Jockey Club is truly unbeatable. The price is so much more affordable and the location is as good as any on the Strip. I totally recommend it. I will go back there for sure.
reviews.title: You can't beat the location and price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got there March 16 and stayed 5 days. The view of the back of the Cosmo wasn't scenic, but the room was clean and we weren't in it that much so the view from the window is no big deal. A little secret is that as a guest here you can also use the two pools at the Cosmo for free, just shpow them your room key.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rented a one bedroom unit on the penthouse level of the Jockey Club while visiting for the 2013 NASCAR races in Las Vegas. After resolving where to park during the check-in process, we were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room we were assigned. It was huge!
reviews.title: So Much Better

reviews.text: The living room had a L-shaped couch that had to be placed a few feet from the wall to help fill the expanse of the room. The walk-in closet in the bedroom had room for a family and housed the room safe and two walls of hangers. The full-wall window had a view of absolutely nothing--- The Cosmopolitan Casino/hotel was built just feet away from the side of this building obstructing the view. They do have views of the Bellagio fountain from some rooms and on two of the cable TV channels. The Wi-Fi was free and fast. The second floor pool was very nice and under-used. Parking is free and abundant in in an underground garage shared with the neighboring casino
reviews.title: Diamond in the rough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel check-in area has the obligatory timeshare / vacation club representative's counter but they were not as obtrusive as others found in Las Vegas.
reviews.title: Watch out for the timeshare touts.

reviews.text: Based on other reviews of this hotel, I booked a suite here as we were looking for something less pricey than a hotel on the Strip. We drove to Vegas and had a really hard time finding this hotel and the parking entrance. There is a small sign right before the Cosmopolitan if you're traveling S on the Strip that's easy to miss. Anyway, once we got parked, it was another challenge to actually find the hotel and lobby as we made the mistake of getting off at the Casino level of the Cosmopolitan & wandering around before finding someone to re-direct us. So I would advise anyone staying here to really get clear directions on where to go if you're driving. If you're taking a taxi, I'm sure it's not an issue because the driver would/should know & can drop you off at the front entrance.
reviews.title: Good location but very hard to find!

reviews.text: We booked a 2 bedroom suite. It was spacious enough but rather dowdy & run down. Bathrooms were small & very basic. Staying here was not my preferred location but since we had 3 in our party & didn't want to share a room, we needed somewhere cheaper than the main hotels but wanted to be close to the strip because we were only in Vegas 1 nite. So it does provide better value as it's close to the Strip & parking was free. Also, there is NO RESORT fees. And if you want to gamble, you are very handy to the casinos in the Cosmopolitan. And the Bellagio is also pretty close so you can dine at their buffet restaurant as the Jockey Club has no restaurant or casinos. Our view from our room was onto the Strip (the Parisian) & a car park below. Early in the morning we were awakened by very loud noises outside - possibly laundry or garbage trucks picking up stuff. Would I stay again? Possibly but not if I could find a great deal at one of the main hotels.
reviews.title: Lovely rooms at the Jockey Club

reviews.text: We just returned from a 4-night stay at the Jockey Club where we were pleasantly surprised by the size and quality of the rooms. We had 5 of us staying in a one-bedroom, 6-sleeper and had plenty of space (of course, we were all considerate with being tidy). Having the extra half-bathroom (toilet and washbasin) was a life-saver.
reviews.title: great stay at the jockey club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 6-seater dining room table meant we could sit down and catch up with each other and whilst an electric kettle would have been perfect, the stove-top kettle worked just as well and boiled very fast. The huge fridge meant that we could have stocked up on plenty of food supplies had we wanted to.
reviews.title: Good Quality for the Price

reviews.text: Check-in was fast and painless but do note that the rooms are not serviced. The dishwasher saved us washing up and the free internet connection was a life-saver. It's worth it for that alone. The cost of the room for the 4 nights was exceptionally reasonable - far less per person than a single night at the Paris Hotel, which is just across the road.
reviews.title: What a great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have tried before to post this important warning about this appalling time-share experience, only to have it removed and relocated to the forums, presumably at the request of the Jockey Club Management.
reviews.title: Truly a boil on the underbelly of Las Vegas

reviews.text: I have noticed that other reviewers have since been allowed to have their say, so I hope that the tripadvisor moderators will reconsider the restriction on free speech and allow this cautionary tale to be read by as many potential future victims as possible.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem in the center of the Strip

reviews.text: We were taken in by the usual promise of comps by those very smartly dressed in the bright red shirts in the Miracle Mile, and we were persuaded to pay a $40 deposit which would be paid back immediately we turned up for the 90 minute tour. Needless to say it was not and after waiting for over an hour in the dump that is the Jockey Club without the tour even starting, we began to ask what was going on. Fortunately I had insisted on getting a photocopy of my deposit receipt and with this in hand asked for either the tour to begin or to be released with my $40 and our show tickets. Eventually we were shown into a room where dozens of shaken and shattered souls who had endured a tour were waiting grimly for their comps. I was informed that we were at the back of a queue that would beat least a further 90 minutes. When I objected to this, an irate woman screamed at me that I should leave , and when another victim complained she taunted him with the words "do you expect to get the money back out of the slot macchines as well, sucker?". He left with his trembling partner when they threatened him with security. Eventually we got our $40 back and our comp tickets and considered ourselves lucky to have escaped the harrowing, brow-beating sales attacks that were described to us, but still thoroughly disgusted that such an ill-intentioned, mean-minded operation should be allowed to flourish in open view, even in Vegas. Such bhaviour should be intolreable in any society that claims to be civilised. The idea that anyone would pay money for a time share in this depressing dump of their own volition or free will is ludicrous, and is clearly why such an approach is deemed necessary. A night in the cellls would be preferable to a night here, and is the very least that the ring leaders of this scam deserve.
reviews.title: Great Timeshare Exchange

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with 5 other gals for a long bachelorette weekend. The rooms are very clean, updated and well taken care of. Housekeeping accommodated every request we made. The location is perfect; close to all the places you want to be. As guests at the Jockey Club, we were allowed to use the Bamboo pool at the Cosmopolitan. The Jockey Club also has a pool, but we did not visit it. A couple of items to be aware of: we asked when we made the reservation for a view of the Bellagio fountains, but were told they were not available upon check-in and the complimentary shuttle only runs on Monday, Tuesday and Thursday, so if you are staying over a weekend it does you no good. However, Walgreen's right across the street has plenty of items available to stock your kitchen in your suite including adult beverages and it is open 24-7. A lot of reviews on this website lead you to believe the timeshare folks just badger you, but we didn't run into any at all. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent location, great property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Jockey Club is a great location in Las Vegas. Bellagio on one side, Cosmopolitan on the other. Our 1br suite was perfect for my wife and I. Wouldn't recommend it for two couples. Our room had a view of the wall if the Cosmopolitan instead if the Bellagio fountains but that would be the only thing I would change.The pool is totally shaded by the Cosmopolitan so this is not the place to stay if you want to sit in the sun poolside. Staff was nice and getting discount tickets to shows was right in the lobby. Go to Beatle show at Planet Hollywood.... $20 a person and includes a drink. Guys did a fun show. When you need a cab, go to entrance of Cosmopolitan. Would stay at Jockey Club again.
reviews.title: Great location, on the Strip

reviews.text: We got the two bedroom condo and were all pleasantly surprised. There were 7 of us total and were very comfortable in this condo. Amazing location on the strip with a great view of the bellagio. I am still amazed at what an awesome deal we got on this place. Great convenience store located in the main lobby with beer and wine!! The store only takes cash so remember to bring some with you! Very clean rooms! Hard to find the connecting door in the cosmo the first time but once you do you won't forget where it is! WE LOVED THE JOCKEY CLUB!!!
reviews.title: BEST BACHELORETTE WEEKEND EVER

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 1 week stay at the Jockey Club Suites in Las Vegas. It is located in the heart of the strip right next to the Bellagio and Cosmopolitan. We had a huge suite with a full kitchen, living/dining room, 2 bed rooms (one with 2 queen sized beds and ensuite) and a family bathroom with walk in shower. We had a huge walk in closet. There was also a pull out queen sized sofa bed in the lounge. We had the most fantastic view over the Bellagio fountains and Paris. The staff were fantastic and friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. We had maid service every day with clean towels etc. The suite was spotless and the beds were so comfy! There was easy access to the Cosmopolitan just down in the lift. We had a hire car and parked in the underground car park which was reached via the Cosmopolitan down to level B3. We always got a parking space and then just took the lift up to the Jockey Club. The Jockey Club is hidden away down a side street but what a little gem of a find, we would definitely stay here again. Fantastic value for money.
reviews.title: Jocky Club Suites Las Vegas - fantastic!

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Jockey Club Suites in Las Vegas. Everything about it was perfect - the location (opp.to Bellagio), amenities,price and service. The apartment was huge for 5 people (> 600 sq feet), the kitchen well-stocked and we had the Bellagio fountain right in front of our window...all for about 100 bucks a night. Definitely recommend and we will be staying here again!
reviews.title: Just excellent

reviews.text: 4 of us returned today from a 1 week stay at the Jockey Club Suites in Las Vegas. Located in the heart of the Strip between the Bellagio and the Cosmopolitan, our one bedroom suite at the Jockey Club was spacious and clean, had a fully equipped kitchen, dining area, a queen pull-out sofa (the mattress on this was awful but we got an egg crate foam pad from guest services that helped a little), a king bed in the nice-sized bedroom, large walk-in closet with plenty of hangars, an in-room safe, free Wi-Fi, DVD player, stereo, 2 flat panel TVs and a small but adequate bathroom. There is a hospitality center with complimentary popcorn & coffee and a free video library, 3 computers for guest use. The hotel has a whirlpool, an outdoor pool, sauna & health club. There is a 24 hour resort desk, daily activities & shuttle service for grocery runs. Staff was friendly and helpful, fulfilling our requests quickly and cheerfully. Price was reasonable and they did not hit us with the "resort fee" that many of the Las Vegas hotels tack on. Parking was always available in the shared ramp with the Cosmopolitan. I would definitely recommend this facility!
reviews.title: Jockey Club Suites Las Vegas is a hidden gem

reviews.text: The Jockey Club gives you the advantage of having a kitchen and living room, which is a real plus over all the hotels it's surrounded with. It's been newly remodeled and is nicely appointed, and is a well kept property. Next time we will ask to be on the north side with the view instead of looking out at a grey wall. We enjoyed the free DVD use and popcorn when settling back into the room at night. The workout room was a bit lacking, the only elliptical machine was out of order my entire stay. Overall, a nice place to stay, a unique place on the strip amongst all the giant hotels, it's more like home.
reviews.title: Excellent location
